description: This trap indicates that no more entries can
be added to the client VNID table . This trap is of
'warning' class.
A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: This trap indicates that the DHCP server attempting to
assign an address in range of static subnet on a
different port. Information on affected port, subnet
mask and the assigned port is also sent with the trap.
This trap is of warning class

event.Summary: DHCP server attempting to assign address from port $v3 (subnet $v2) on port $v1

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD PDN-DOMAIN-MIB::dhcpAddressInStaticSubnet RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex i 9999 PDN-DOMAIN-MIB::pdnClientConfigSubnetMask a 192.0.2.1 RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex i 9999

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's
network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex

description: The subnet mask of the client.
variables.name: PDN-DOMAIN-MIB::pdnClientConfigSubnetMask

description: A unique value for each interface. Its value
ranges between 1 and the value of ifNumber. The
value for each interface must remain constant at
least from one re-initialization of the entity's

initialization.
variables.name: RFC1213-MIB::ifIndex
